page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: Most of the farms around Strathaven are hill farms.They mainly stock dairy cattle known as Fresians though some beef cattle are also kept.Sheep,hens and goats are also found.The main crop is Barley but potatoes, cabbage, turnips and silage are also produced.During the winter the farmers feed the cattle with turnips hay silage and an enriched substance like treacle. Most of the farms in the area are between two and five hundred acres in extent although several larger farms contain more than six hundred acres. Some land is now used by the Forestry Commission who plant quick growing evergreens which in future will be made into furniture etc. although this is negligible compared with other forms of land use.
